p: Soluble sugars presented a large variation between the four tested origins ( Table 4). These values were higher than those previously reported in Indian cumin, just as in a collection of Iranian populations [ 60, 62, 66]. These differences may be explained by environmental and/or genetic effects [ 66]. It has been reported that drought, salinity, low temperatures and floods may increase the concentrations of soluble sugars, while high light irradiance, heavy metals, nutrient scarcity and ozone can decrease these concentrations in seeds. Nevertheless, changes in sugar content do not follow a static pattern and may vary with genotypes and stresses [ 67].
